title: Agricultural Inputs Delivery to Remote Farms
desc_split: A cooperative needs to distribute farming essentials like fertilizer and seeds to isolated farms scattered across rugged terrain. Trucks depart from the central warehouse (<loc_depot>) and must deliver exact quantities (<demand>) to each farm (<loc_customer>). Each truck has a maximum load capacity of <capacity> kg. Farmers expect deliveries within a day, so routes must not exceed a <distance_limit> km range to avoid overnight stays. Drivers can end their shift at the last farm visited. The goal is to minimize total travel while ensuring no farm is overlooked and trucks stay under both capacity and distance constraints.
label: ovrpl

title: Medical Diagnostic Equipment Redistribution
desc_split: A hospital network must temporarily redistribute portable diagnostic machines (e.g., ultrasound scanners) to understaffed clinics during a health crisis. Each clinic (<loc_customer>) requires a specific number of devices (<demand>). Medical transport vans from the main hub (<loc_depot>) can carry up to <capacity> machines. Due to battery life limitations, vans must complete routes within <distance_limit> km to ensure equipment functionality. Drivers are not required to return to the depot after final deliveries. Plan routes that satisfy all clinic demands without overloading vans or exceeding distance limits.
label: ovrpl

title: Construction Material Delivery to Remote Mining Sites
desc_split: A mining company operates in a remote region and needs to supply construction materials (steel beams, concrete) to active sites. title: Urban Perishable Food Distribution to Food Shelters
desc_split:
A city’s food bank operates from a central warehouse (<loc_depot>) and needs to deliver perishable groceries to <num_customer> urban food shelters. Each truck has a maximum capacity (<capacity> kg) to ensure freshness and prevent spoilage. The shelters are scattered across the city, and each requires a specific amount of supplies (<demand> kg). The goal is to design routes that:  
- Avoid overloading any truck beyond its capacity.  
- Ensure no route exceeds a maximum distance (<distance_limit> km) to minimize travel time and keep food fresh.  
- Allow drivers to end their day at the last shelter visited, eliminating unnecessary return trips.
